column4: hi i just installed ubuntu and when i start my pc up it just says error 17 and stops can someone help me?? (BTW: i am in live on the pc in question)
hi i just installed ubuntu and when i start my pc up it just says error 17 and stops can someone help me?? (BTW: i am in live on the pc in question)
does it give you that error when you boot, or when the OS is up and stable?
just a sec.  I'll go look @ my error logs.
I think its because your BIOS dosen't like the size of your disk.
its because grub can't mount the selected partition.  Go run LVM when you partition your diskes
i have a 250gb hard drive with windows ME on hda1 (130gb) and ybuntu on hda2 (113 gb)
so M$ is @ the start of your drive?
yes

Every time I tried to do that, it caused my problems.  If I rember corectly, I had to install M$, resize the partition with partition magic, then toss in the Ubuntu CD.  Once it started to chew on things, I had to make sure that it ignored the M$ partition, installed Grub, and made sure th BIOS could read a disk that large.
now you have me scared because i dont have a clue how todo that
just figure out if your BIOS can handle the large drive (read past the 8Gb mark), then have fun resizing your partition.  Once thats done, then its a peice of cake.
so how can i find out if my bois can do that?
i cant get into windows now
so do i have to put it n the spot ms is?
<rolls eyes>   I don't supose you read how to set up Grub for a M$ partition?
ok if i reinstall ubuntu in the first partition will that fix it?
here ya go.  first search artical.  http://www.google.ca/search?hl=en&q=grub+%22dual+boot%22&meta=
did you look @ that link?
open a seprate chat and I'll tell you how to.
do you think if i reinstalled ubuntu in front of ms it would work?
none of the stuff in the terminal works right
do you think if i reinstalled ubuntu in front of ms it would work?
